p: ICV infection is more commonly associated with hospitalization and lower respiratory disease in young children ( Table 1). ICV-associated hospitalization occurs most often among children <3 years of age and cases of Intensive Care Unit admission among infants with prematurity and congenital heart disease have been described, as well as otherwise healthy young children [ 1, 100, 103]. Among children hospitalized for ICV infection, co-morbidity is reported in 58â€“80% of cases [ 1, 103]. Prematurity is the most common comorbidity present in ICV-associated hospitalization; however, asthma, IgG deficiency, acute lymphoblastic leukemia, cystic fibrosis, and congenital heart disease have also been described [ 1, 103].
